conclusion: Use the ideal gas law and the constant relationship of pV/T for an ideal gas.
The p-V graph shows states A, B, and C with respective coordinates.
Identify given values and convert temperatures to Kelvin for state A.
Calculate the constant pV/T for state A using given values.
Use the constant to find the temperature T_C for state C.
Calculate T_C and find it to be 300 K.
The temperature of the gas in state C is 300 K.
